column2: The whole EU bus fleet consists of around 715.000-750.000 vehicles, with city buses representing around 215.000 units
column5: The target of having 100% zero-emission urban buses by 2030 is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing emissions from transport sector by 90% by 2050, as urban buses are a significant contributor to transport emissions.

column2: The whole EU bus fleet consists of around 715.000-750.000 vehicles, with city buses representing around 215.000 units
column5: The target of having 100% zero-emission urban buses by 2030 is likely to have a positive impact on the target of having at least 30 million zero-emission cars and 80,000 zero-emission lorries by 2030, as it promotes the adoption of zero-emission vehicles.

column2: Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029
column5: The target of increasing the use of recycled materials in new vehicles may have a negative impact on the target of collecting and recycling plastic bottles, as it may lead to a decrease in the demand for virgin plastics.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the recovery targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: 85% for Category 1 or Category 4, 80% for Category 2, 75% for Category 5 or 6
column5: The target of building 1,000 hydrogen stations by 2030 is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as hydrogen fuel cell vehicles are a type of WEEE.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the preparation for re-use targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: 80% for Category 1 or Category 4, 70% for Category 2, 55% for Category 5 or Category 6
column5: The target of preparing for re-use of WEEE is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing waste generation, as it promotes the reuse and recycling of waste.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the recycling targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: 0% for Category 1 or Category 4, 70% for Category 2, 55% for Category 5 or Category 6
column5: The target of recycling WEEE is likely to have a positive impact on the target of setting up at least one publicly accessible recharging point for electric vehicles, as it promotes the recycling of materials used in electric vehicles.

column2: By 2025, the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste shall be increased to a minimum of 55% by weight (60% by 2030, 65% by 2035)
column5: The target of increasing the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste is likely to have a positive impact on the target of setting up recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles, as it promotes the recycling of materials used in electric vehicles.

column2: Member States should aim to achieve an indicative Union-wide food waste reduction target of 30 % by 2025 and 50 % by 2030
column5: The target of reducing food waste is likely to have a positive impact on the target of increasing the use of alternative fuels in the transport sector, as it promotes the use of waste as a resource.

column2: Hazardous household waste will have to be collected separately by 2022, bio-waste by 2023 and textiles by 2025
column5: The target of collecting hazardous household waste separately is likely to have a positive impact on the target of increasing the use of renewable energy in the transport sector, as it promotes the use of waste as a resource.

column5: There is no target content for TA3.48, so there is no impact on TA4.29.

column2: By 2030 producers will have responsibility for their products along the value chain, including when they become waste. The circular textiles ecosystem is thriving, driven by sufficient capacities for innovative fibre-to-fibre recycling
column5: The target of promoting circular textiles is likely to have a positive impact on the target of setting up at least one publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling station in each urban node, as it promotes the use of recycled materials.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The target of ensuring access to critical raw materials is likely to have a positive impact on the target of increasing the use of renewable energy in the transport sector, as it promotes the use of domestic resources.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The target of ensuring access to critical raw materials is likely to have a positive impact on the target of increasing the use of renewable energy in the transport sector, as it promotes the use of domestic resources.

column2: *The amendments in Dir. 2023/2413 are also intended to support the achievement of the Unionâ€™s target of an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030
column5: The target of increasing the production of sustainable biomethane is likely to have a positive impact on the target of having 100% zero-emission urban buses by 2030, as biomethane can be used as a fuel for urban buses.

column5: The target of reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column2: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030
column5: The target of reducing fuel intensity in the fisheries sector is likely to have a positive impact on the target of having 100% zero-emission urban buses by 2030, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column2: Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years
column5: The target of reducing the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations is likely to have a positive impact on the target of collecting and recycling plastic bottles, as it promotes the use of more efficient logistics.

column2: GHG intensity reduction target in the maritime sector
column5: The target of reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column2: For new urban buses the share of zeroemissions vehicles shall be 100% as from the reporting period of the year 2030
column5: The target of having 100% zero-emission urban buses by 2030 is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing emissions from transport sector by 90% by 2050, as urban buses are a significant contributor to transport emissions.

column2: Renewable and low-carbon fuels should represent between 6% and 9% of the international maritime transport fuel mix by 2030 and between 86% and 88% by 2050
column5: The target of increasing the use of renewable and low-carbon fuels in the maritime sector is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of alternative fuels.

column2: The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles, other than special purpose, off-road, off-road special purpose, and vocational vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019
column5: The target of reducing CO2 emissions from heavy-duty vehicles is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column2: The EU fleet-wide target of 95 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new passenger cars and an EU fleet-wide target of 147 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new light commercial vehicles registered in the Union
column5: The target of reducing CO2 emissions from passenger cars and light commercial vehicles is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column2: This Regulation will, until 31 December 2024, be complemented by additional measures corresponding to a reduction of 10 g CO2/km as part of the Union's integrated approach
column5: The target of reducing CO2 emissions from passenger cars and light commercial vehicles is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing food waste, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column5: There is no target content for TA4.18, so there is no impact on TA3.46.

column2: nan
column5: There is no target content for TA4.19, so there is no impact on TA3.47.

column2: In the first phase, from 2020 up to 2024, the strategic objective is to install at least 6 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers in the EU and the production of up to 1 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen
column5: The target of increasing the production of renewable hydrogen is likely to have a positive impact on the target of having 100% zero-emission urban buses by 2030, as renewable hydrogen can be used as a fuel for urban buses.

column2: In a third phase, from 2030 onwards and towards 2050, renewable hydrogen technologies should reach maturity and be deployed at large scale to reach all hard-to-decarbonise sectors where other alternatives might not be feasible or have higher costs
column5: The target of increasing the use of renewable hydrogen is likely to have a positive impact on the target of collecting and recycling plastic bottles, as it promotes the use of alternative fuels.

column2: Build three million public electric charging points by 2030. Build one million public electric charging points by 2025
column5: The target of increasing the number of public electric charging points is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of electric vehicles.

column2: Build 1.000 hydrogen stations by 2030. By 2025, build half of the 1.000 hydrogen stations needed for 2030
column5: The target of increasing the number of hydrogen stations is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of hydrogen fuel cell vehicles.

column2: nan
column5: There is no target content for TA4.24, so there is no impact on TA3.43.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, at the end of each year, starting from 2026, the following power output targets are met cumulatively
column5: The target of increasing the power output of recharging stations is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of electric vehicles.

column2: Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive networks, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them
column5: The target of increasing the number of recharging pools is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing food waste, as it promotes the use of electric vehicles.

column2: Along the TEN-T core road network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km between them
column5: The target of increasing the number of recharging pools for heavy-duty electric vehicles is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing emissions from transport sector by 90% by 2050, as heavy-duty vehicles are a significant contributor to transport emissions.

column2: By 31 December 2030, in each safe and secure parking area at least four publicly accessible recharging stations dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an individual power output of at least 100 kW are deployed
column5: The target of increasing the number of recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing emissions from transport sector by 90% by 2050, as heavy-duty vehicles are a significant contributor to transport emissions.

column2: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an aggregated power output of at least 1 800 kW are deployed
column5: The target of increasing the number of recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles is likely to have a positive impact on the target of having 100% zero-emission urban buses by 2030, as heavy-duty vehicles are a significant contributor to transport emissions.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, at least one publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling station is deployed in each urban node
column5: The target of increasing the number of hydrogen refuelling stations is likely to have a positive impact on the target of collecting and recycling plastic bottles, as it promotes the use of alternative fuels.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations designed for a minimum cumulative capacity of 1 tonne per day and equipped with at least a 700 bar dispenser are deployed with a maximum distance of 200 km between them along the TEN-T core network
column5: The target of increasing the number of hydrogen refuelling stations is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of hydrogen fuel cell vehicles.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, at all airports of the TEN-T core network and TEN-T comprehensive network, the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured by 31 December 2029
column5: The target of increasing the use of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column2: Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025
column5: The target of increasing the use of shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column2: Member States shall ensure that a minimum shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships is provided in TEN-T maritime ports
column5: The target of increasing the use of shore-side electricity supply to seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column2: Transport by inland waterways and short sea shipping will increase by 25% compared to 2015, by 2030
column5: The target of increasing the use of inland waterways and short sea shipping is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing emissions from transport sector by 90% by 2050, as it promotes the use of more efficient modes of transport.

column2: Rail freight traffic will increase by 50% compared to 2015 by 2030
column5: The target of increasing the use of rail freight traffic is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing emissions from transport sector by 90% by 2050, as it promotes the use of more efficient modes of transport.

column2: High-speed rail traffic will double compared to 2015, by 2030
column5: The target of increasing the use of high-speed rail traffic is likely to have a positive impact on the target of having 100% zero-emission urban buses by 2030, as high-speed rail traffic is a more efficient mode of transport.

column2: The multimodal Trans-European Transport Network (TEN-T) equipped for sustainable and smart transport with high-speed connectivity will be operational for the core network by 2030
column5: The target of increasing the use of the TEN-T network is likely to have a positive impact on the target of collecting and recycling plastic bottles, as it promotes the use of more efficient logistics.

column2: Rail and waterborne-based intermodal transport will be able to compete on equal footing with road-only transport in the EU
column5: The target of increasing the use of intermodal transport is likely to have a positive impact on the target of recovering at least 65% of WEEE, as it promotes the use of more efficient modes of transport.

column2: Scheduled collective travel of under 500 km should be carbon neutral within the EU
column5: The target of reducing emissions from scheduled collective travel is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing food waste, as it promotes the use of more efficient modes of transport.

column2: Nearly all cars, vans, buses as well as new heavy-duty vehicles will be zero-emission
column5: The target of increasing the use of zero-emission vehicles is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing emissions from transport sector by 90% by 2050, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.

column2: There will be at least 30 million zero-emission cars and 80.000 zero-emission lorries in operation
column5: The target of increasing the number of zero-emission cars and lorries is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing emissions from transport sector by 90% by 2050, as it promotes the use of more efficient technologies.
